intro: Echinopepon lanatus, commonly known as the wooly pumpkin, is a unique member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and large, lobed leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces orange to yellow fruits that are typically elongated and cylindrical in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Echinopepon lanatus is native to arid regions of Africa and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils.
